id: FME Over Breakfast-75 Featherston Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: FME Over Breakfast
venue: 75 Featherston Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Start your day with coffee, kai and a fresh take on enterprise data integration.
This free breakfast session is designed for digital, data, and IT professionals exploring more flexible, scalable and cost-effective alternatives to platforms like Boomi, Alteryx, Talend and Informatica.
Discover how FME powers everything from cloud integration and workflow orchestration to API management, data validation, and real-time system connectivity, all in one platform.
Join your hosts Locus and experience the powerful, no-code answer to systems integration.
Who should attend?

id: Ceremonial Cacao, psychedelics, and neuroplasticity - exploring shamanic practices of Peru-147 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Ceremonial Cacao, psychedelics, and neuroplasticity - exploring shamanic practices of Peru
venue: 147 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Join us for an immersive workshop  that bridges ancient indigenous traditions with cutting-edge neuroscience to explore the powerful intersection of cacao, psychedelics, and spiritual transformation.
We will delve into the cosmovision that links cacao with psychedelic plant medicines and how these ancient practices are integrated with modern scientific understanding.
Shamans used ceremonial cacao to connect with the divine and combined it with San Pedro cactus to induce visionary experiences.
If you’re passionate about cacao and curious about its transformative potential, this workshop  will expand your understanding and deepen your connection with this sacred plant.
Whether you’re a cacao lover or a seeker on a spiritual path, this experience will open your mind to the possibilities cacao holds for healing, awakening, and change.

id: Soul To Sole-11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Soul To Sole
venue: 11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
description:
Join us for a series of 5Rhythms® Moving Meditation classes This is a creative space focused on dance as practice of presence versus performance Gabrielle Roth, founder of this dynamic practice was the Grandmother of modern day ecstatic dance.
Her lineage of embodiment is brought to you from international teachers Douglas and Lucia.
Join us as we together weave an evening of high vibration exploration.
Come ready to sweat!
This is a class design for every body of all ages and abilities.

id: Gong Bath at Lotus Centre, Paraparaumu-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Gong Bath at Lotus Centre, Paraparaumu
description:
*Limited door sales for $25* *Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth* Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being.
The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

id: Wellington Regional Speed Puzzling Event-Gate 3/48 Somme Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Wellington Regional Speed Puzzling Event
venue: Gate 3/48 Somme Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand
description:
Participants get to take their puzzle home afterwards.
Speed puzzling is fun and invigorating no matter what your speed is.
There will be other fun activities on the day for the whole family to enjoy, a puzzle swap and a pop-up jigsaw puzzle store.
There is also a café on site for refreshments, plus accommodation is available at the NZCIS.
Full event details will be sent out to all participants prior to the event.

id: The Warratahs-11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: The Warratahs
venue: 11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand
description:
The Warratahs Live at the Upper Hutt Cossie Club – Saturday 2nd August After nearly four decades on the road, The Warratahs remain one of New Zealand’s most beloved bands — and now they’re returning to the Upper Hutt Cossie Club for a very special show.
With 37 years of touring behind them, The Warratahs have left a deep mark on Kiwi music.
Their legacy includes seven studio albums that made the charts, a Tui Music Award for Country Album of the Year in 2017, and performances alongside legends like Johnny Cash & The Highwaymen, Lucinda Williams, and Jackson Browne.
Barry Saunders’ iconic songwriting is woven into the fabric of the New Zealand songbook, and this is your chance to witness the band at their best.
Born out of a simple love for playing music with mates down at the pub, The Warratahs first hit the stage at The Cricketers’ Arms in Wellington in 1986 — never imagining they’d become a national treasure.

id: Niko Ne Zna Live at Vogelmorn Hall (Wellington)-13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Niko Ne Zna Live at Vogelmorn Hall (Wellington)
venue: 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
description:
Wellington, get ready!
It’s been a minute!
Fresh off a sold-out show in Auckland, Niko Ne Zna returns to the capital for a night of explosive Balkan brass at Vogelmorn Hall.
Expect bold brass, infectious rhythms, soaring vocals, and a dancefloor that won’t quit.
This nine-piece powerhouse delivers their signature high-energy performance — featuring brand new songs in preparation for their upcoming third studio album, as well as all the hits you know and love.

id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Jake Baxendale-Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Jake Baxendale
venue: Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
The eighth concert in our series is a new suite of music by local composer, performer, and wearer of excellent hats; Jake Baxendale.
For this concert, Jake is lifting his gaze from the domestic to the majestic with his new suite of music for improvisers, “Sky Meets Country”.
These new compositions utilise tools Jake developed for his Gardening Music ensemble: but where that music takes a granular approach to musical cells, simulating the inward posture of grubbing around in the earth, this new work expands outward to capture the feeling of vastness that open landscapes, bush canopies, and wide, blue skies can inspire.
Jake has written, performed, and recorded extensively over his career, including "Waypeople", a commission for the Wellington Jazz Festival in 2023, and releasing his latest album "Gardening Music" earlier this year.
Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

id: Wellington Salsa Ball-4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Wellington Salsa Ball
venue: 4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
The Wellington Salsa Ball brings together live music and dancers from across the region for the city’s biggest Latin dance social of the year!
Whether you’re a beginner or seasoned dancer, this event is for you!
Your ticket includes: 💃 4+ hours of social dancing 🎺 A 90 minute live Salsa set from Wellington’s own C-26 Salsa Band 🎧 DJ Panda playing Salsa + Bachata with a sprinkling of Zouk + Kizomba ✨ A stunning venue with a beautiful wooden dance floor 📷 Professional photos to remember the night (social dancing and photo wall) 🍹 Access to the in-house bar Tickets are limited - and be sure to grab a cheaper ticket while they are still available!
Dress code: The Ball is absolutely an opportunity to dress up!
Event schedule: 8:00pm (Doors open + social dancing begins) 9:30pm - 11:00pm (C-26 live Salsa set) 11:00pm (Social dancing continues) 1:00am (Party ends) This event is made possible with support from Salsa Magic and the wider Wellington latin dance community.

id: Botanical Watercolour on Calf Vellum-101 Glenmore Street, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Botanical Watercolour on Calf Vellum
venue: 101 Glenmore Street, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
description:
'Have you ever wondered what all the fuss is about vellum?
Botanical artist, Lesley Alexander will share her knowledge of painting on vellum.
Used as a writing and painting surface since before the Middle Ages, Lesley loves the luminosity and glow that can be achieved working this traditional way.
You will learn: what vellum is how it is prepared it's uses now and in times past how to prepare the vellum with pumice powder and watercolour techniques to work on this very beautiful surface before spending the rest of the time painting a small colourful Pohutukawa leaf.
Ideally you will have some experience using watercolour but that is not essential.

id: Catfish Trifecta presents: The Cuck Chair-17b Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Catfish Trifecta presents: The Cuck Chair
venue: 17b Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
You hate improv?
Tell us why… then be forced to watch it.
From the unhinged minds of Wellington’s most insane comedy trio (Mo Munn, Ralph Hilaga, and Joel Luscombe) comes an original improv comedy format that is so boundary-breaking and genre-defining that it made Van Gogh s**t his pants.
What begins as punishment becomes prophecy, as Catfish Trifecta performs relentlessly, defiantly and with far too much commitment, finishing towards an unholy finale nobody asked for.
You won’t be ready, but you’re coming anyway.

id: Native plant papermaking for Christmas-27A Elizabeth Street, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Native plant papermaking for Christmas
description:
In this festive papermaking workshop, you will create a range of tasteful and ecofriendly ornaments and gifts, using our sustainably made harakeke pulp.
Be ready to get your hands wet!
This is an all-ages workshop and children (5+) are welcome to attend with a caregiver.
All paper produced during the workshop will be pressed and dried by the tutor and sent out to participants 2-3 weeks after the workshop.
This workshop is supported by the Kāpiti Coast District Council as part of their Sustainable Spring programme.

id: Midnight: The Cinderella Musical-1 Monorgan Road, Strathmore Park, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Midnight: The Cinderella Musical
venue: 1 Monorgan Road, Strathmore Park, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
description:
MIDNIGHT is a major new musical that is sure to delight audiences young and old!
Loosely inspired by the Cinderella story, this ground-breaking and enchanting new tale features Ella, a feisty, funny and passionate young heroine who doesn’t want or need a so-called Prince Charming.
Enchanted by this alluring stranger, the prince finds himself in uncharted territory and quickly learns that "Ella" is like no other.
Can he prove his worth?
Can she ignite his desire for change?

id: After Austen: Em-2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: After Austen: Em
venue: 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Emmett Woodhouse, handsome, clever and rich, with a comfortable home and a gay disposition has lived nearly [redacted] years in the world with very little to distress or vex him.
Attendees get an exclusive 10% discount at Unity Books Bring a friend: purchase 2 or more tickets and get a 10% discount Sam Brooks is an award-winning and prolific playwright and journalist, who is largely noted for his critically acclaimed LGBTQ+ work, including Riding in Cars with (Mostly Straight) Boys, Queen, and most recently This is My Story of Us, which was co-winner of the 2024 Adam New Zealand Play Award.
He has been shortlisted multiple years for the Adam New Zealand Play Award, and won the Dean Parker award in 2023.
Who this event is for: People who love Austen People who love the theatre Fans of Sam's work Writers Actors Directors Afternoon tea provided (If you have issues paying via credit card you can pay via invoice or contact us - this should be fixed now) FAQs Do I need to know about Jane Austen?
We want you to be there and we want you to be comfortable.
